TopicTitle: Need help tracking down what's causing a memory leak/cause of a hard crash

Articles.Content:
So, KSP keeps hard crashing whenever I try to load this station I've created. The station is a gigantic mix of Spacelab (ETS), Real ISS and Planned ISS. 

Every time I try to load the station it with either A) Memory Leak to hell and back, using up all 64gigs of my Ram or B) Crash so hard that it freezes up other applications (Like edge, discord, etc)

Here's the logs:

https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fo/nr2qg8m6trcl8ihiyjpfq/h?rlkey=xoa5s9gnl8kkikmpl5cg2bjow&dl=0
What happens when you remove from your KSP all the ones that show an error in loading?

Fresh downloading and installing DockingCamKURS fixed the issue.... strange. 

The files must have gotten corrupted or something.

Nevermind, still crashes, and I think DockingCamKURS is the culprit... removing it and trying KSP one more time. 

Distant Object Enhancement was also throwing errors, so I updated that to the latest version.

Yep, it was DockingCamKURS. 

IDK why...
